instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used to evaluate winter wheat plant nitrogen concentration (PNC) at different growth stages?
Output: To evaluate winter wheat plant nitrogen concentration (PNC) at different growth stages,the researchers used remote sensing spectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to evaluate winter wheat plant nitrogen concentration (PNC) at different growth stages?
Output: Stepwise multiple linear regression (SMLR), partial least squares regression (PLSR), random forest regression (RFR), support vector machine regression (SVMR), and extreme learning machine regression (ELMR) models based on spectral indexes were used to evaluate winter wheat plant nitrogen concentration (PNC) at different growth stages.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate winter wheat plant nitrogen concentration (PNC) at different growth stages?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the estimation accuracy of winter wheat PNC at different growth stages using unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) hyperspectral imagery was the root mean square error (RMSE) of the validation set.

instruction: What were the three machine learning methods used in the related study to estimate winter wheat plant nitrogen concentration (PNC) at different growth stages using UAV hyperspectral imagery?
Output:
The three machine learning methods used in the related study to estimate winter wheat plant nitrogen concentration (PNC) at different growth stages using UAV hyperspectral imagery were:
1) Random forest regression (RFR)
2) Support vector machine regression (SVMR)
3) Extreme learning machine regression (ELMR)

instruction: How did the machine learning regression methods, specifically support vector machine regression (SVMR) and random forest regression (RFR), compare to parametric regression and linear nonparametric regression in terms of improving the estimation accuracy of winter wheat PNC at different growth stages using UAV hyperspectral imagery?
Output:
The machine learning regression methods, specifically support vector machine regression (SVMR) and random forest regression (RFR), were found to significantly improve the estimation accuracy of winter wheat plant nitrogen concentration (PNC) compared to parametric regression and linear nonparametric regression. 

The study showed that SVMR and RFR, when used with UAV hyperspectral imagery, achieved the most outstanding estimation performance for winter wheat PNC. The training set of the model at the flowering and filling stages explained 93% and 92% of the PNC variability, respectively. 

Furthermore, the testing set of the model at the flowering and filling stages explained 88% and 91% of the PNC variability. The root mean square error of the validation set (RMSEtesting) was 0.82 and 1.23, and the relative prediction deviation (RPD) was 2.58 and 2.40, respectively. 

Based on these results, it can be concluded that using SVMR and RFR with UAV hyperspectral imagery is the best choice for estimating winter wheat PNC, particularly at the flowering and filling stages. These findings provide a theoretical basis for developing a precision nitrogen management (PNM) strategy.
